para: When the condition parameter of a is set to AcceptanceRate, iteration of a will stop when the fraction of successful modifications falls below the given acceptance_rate threshold.

The acceptance rate is defined as
Acceptance Rate = \(N_\mathrm{accepted}/ N_\mathrm{attempted}\times100\),
where \(N_\mathrm{accepted}\) and
\(N_\mathrm{attempted}\) represent the number of &node; moves accepted and attempted during the operation.
When the acceptance rate of an iterative method like or gets too low, it means that the algorithm is no longer operating effectively, and other methods (or other parameter values) should be used.

tip.para: In graphics mode, it's always possible to abort an iterative operation by pressing the Stop button in the Activity Viewer window. In text mode, use control-C.
